page.title: 09Housing
page.content: Before the Tay Rail Bridge was built only farms and scattered houses existed in Wormit and Newport. When the first bridge was built in 1878 lots of business people from Dundee settled in Wormit and Newport and so the older houses which now exist started to be built. These houses had big rooms, big windows and elaborate wrought iron decorations. Today 17% of housing in Wormit and Newport is council owned and 83% is privately owned. 10% of the private houses are rented. The modern houses are brick built with harled walls. Any spare bit of land is used for building new houses.* Some of the big Victorian houses have been altered into flats. * Many of the new houses have been specially constructed as sheltered dwellings for old people.
